CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS
Title 18 - Agency Authority

PART 318 - AGENCY AUTHORITY REGULATIONS

Authority: 45 U.S.C. 333

§ 318.1 Purpose and scope.
The purpose of this part is to establish regulations governing agency authority in accordance with federal statutory requirements and administrative policy.

§ 318.2 Definitions.
For purposes of this part:
(a) Agency Authority means the regulatory framework established under federal law.
(b) Compliance means adherence to all applicable requirements set forth in this part.
(c) Violation means any failure to comply with the requirements of this part.

§ 318.3 General requirements.
All entities subject to this regulation must comply with federal standards for agency authority. Compliance includes documentation, reporting, and adherence to established procedures.

§ 318.4 Compliance procedures.
Compliance with agency authority regulations requires submission of required documentation, adherence to reporting schedules, and maintenance of records as specified by the administering agency.

§ 318.5 Enforcement.
The administering agency has authority to investigate violations, issue compliance orders, and pursue enforcement actions for violations of agency authority requirements.

§ 318.6 Penalties.
Violations of this part may result in civil penalties, administrative sanctions, or other enforcement actions as provided by law.

Effective Date: 2020-04-22
Federal Register Citation: 81 FR 17974 (2021)
